late in the season for this but for offseason if any teams are interested I’ve put together a java framework (with a pinch of python) which handles simulation with supers, multiple apriltag feeds being blended for pose estimation, automatic auto option additions from pathplanner, built in advantage kit logging, \u0026amp; ML detection servers for teams using google corals if anyone is interested.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe whole goal of this is to bring high end features such as full field localization to newer or less experienced teams helping to open and free up a lot of the new progress that’s been made in FIRST in the past few years.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://github.com/NE-Robotics/Java-Framework\" rel=\"noopener nofollow ugc\"\u003eNE-Robotics/Java-Framework: An opensource FRC java framework to make blending simulated \u0026amp; real robot code a breeze since as every programmer knows you will always get the bot last,
